sentences: About the job
SEO Director - Technical Focus
We're seeking an experienced SEO Director to lead our agency's search engine optimization efforts, with a particular emphasis on technical SEO.
In this role, you'll drive organic growth for our clients through innovative strategies and cutting-edge technical optimizations.
Responsibilities:
Technical SEO Leadership:
Spearhead technical SEO audits, identifying and prioritizing critical issues impacting site performance and search visibility
Develop and implement advanced technical SEO strategies, including site architecture optimization, crawlability improvements, and indexation management
Collaborate with development teams to review code and make cogent change requests that consider technical limitations
Strategy and Execution:
Create comprehensive SEO roadmaps aligned with client KPIs and business objectives
Oversee the execution of on-page and off-page SEO tactics, ensuring alignment with best practices and search engine guidelines
Stay at the forefront of SEO trends, algorithm updates, and emerging technologies, incorporating new approaches into client strategies
Develop and execute local SEO programs for both brick and mortar and service area type businesses
Team Management and Client Relations:
Lead and mentor a team of SEO specialists, fostering a culture of continuous learning and innovation
Serve as the primary point of contact for high-priority clients, communicating complex SEO concepts in clear, actionable terms
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to integrate SEO with broader digital marketing initiatives
Help in the strategy development and planning for new business pitches as well as the delivery of the pitch
Requirements:
7+ years of SEO experience, with at least 2-3 years in a leadership role
Deep expertise in technical SEO, including experience with JavaScript frameworks, e-commerce platforms, and various content management systems
Strong analytical skills with proficiency in SEO tools like Google Search Console, Site Crawlers, BrightEdge, Conductor, Similarweb, Botify, etc.
Proven track record of driving significant organic growth for clients through technical SEO optimizations
Excellent project management abilities and experience leading cross-functional teams
Strong communication skills, both written and verbal, with the ability to explain complex technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders
Preferred Qualifications
Agency and in-house corporate experience preferred
Advanced knowledge of HTML, CSS, and JavaScript
Familiarity with log file analysis and large-scale data processing
Experience with international SEO and hreflang implementation
Understanding of machine learning (AI) and its applications in SEO
Experience in planning and executing business pitches/proposals
At our agency, you'll have the opportunity to work with diverse clients, leverage cutting-edge SEO tools, and lead a team of talented professionals.
If you're passionate about technical SEO and ready to drive organic growth at scale, we want to hear from you.

The Business Systems Project Manager will provide analysis, design, programming solutions, and support for SAP S4HANA business systems efficiently and economically consistent with user & business objectives.
They will prioritize projects, allocate resources, and be an application specialist.
In addition, they will plan and direct the installation and support of business systems SAP S4 projects involving multiple systems impacting multiple functional areas of the business.
Required Skills:
Demonstrated project management experience and configuration & programming knowledge in SAP ECC and/or SAP S/4HANA. SAP S/4HANA experience is a plus.
Experience with business intelligence and report writing platforms.
Experience using 3rd Party tools/systems with SAP.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
Excellent oral and written communication skills using the English language to translate business needs into application system changes to ensure successful business processes.
Required Work Experience:
Education Requirements:
BS in Management Information Systems, Computer Science, or a related field
Job Title: Tech-Savvy Financial Planner - Join Our Innovative Team!
Job Description:
Are you looking for a forward-thinking, technology-driven firm that offers a collaborative and growth-oriented environment?
Join our dynamic financial planning team, where we serve high-net-worth clients nationwide.
In this role, you will deliver tailored financial planning services to an existing book of business and have the opportunity to build your own client base within the Mountain Time Zone.
We’re looking for a self-motivated, detail-focused professional passionate about financial planning and eager to grow within a supportive team.
In this role, you will:
Leverage innovative tools and technology to streamline financial planning processes and enhance client experiences.
Build and maintain strong relationships with clients, ensuring their financial goals are met through comprehensive financial planning.
Contribute to the refinement of our wealth transition strategies and planning services.
Embrace opportunities for professional development in a fast-evolving financial landscape.
Qualifications and Experience:
Experience with eMoney is a must
At least 5 years in financial advisory, including advice planning, book of business management, and client relations, with minimum of 2+ years in wealth management for high-net-worth individuals.
Proven track record in managing a client book of business with high levels of client satisfaction and loyalty.
Strong understanding of financial planning, investment strategies, and industry regulations.
Demonstrated experience applying trust and estate planning principles to enhance clients' wealth preservation.
Bachelor’s degree from an accredited institution; preferred majors include financial planning, finance, or accounting.
Preferred designations include CFP, CPA, CIMA, or EA, or equivalent experience and education.
FINRA Series 7, 63+65, or 66 license
Familiarity with financial planning software (eMoney preferred), tax modeling (BNA Income Tax Planner preferred), and tax preparation software (CCH Access preferred).
Proficiency with Excel and data visualization tools.
Exceptional analytical skills, as well as strong written and verbal communication abilities.
Company Overview:
The AmeriFlex Group is a leading Hybrid RIA, helping clients navigate major life transitions.
With headquarters in Las Vegas, NV, our team of over 200 advisors across the country manages assets exceeding $13 billion.
We prioritize a planning-first approach and offer a unique hybrid platform that includes an advisor-owned RIA with a Partner Advisor ownership model.
Our Broker/Dealer partner is Osaic.
Location:
Flexible - Remote or In-Person (Mountain Coast Time Zone Preferred)
Salary and Benefits:
Earn a competitive salary between $120,000 and $175,000, depending on your experience and credentials.
Our comprehensive benefits package includes a 401(k), health insurance, and reimbursement for approved professional development expenses.
Application Process:
To apply, please send your resume and a compelling cover letter to Stacy Leal at stacy@theameriflexgroup.com.
Contact Information:
Stacy Leal | Phone: 702-987-9730 | AmeriFlex.com
Equal Opportunity Employer Statement:
The AmeriFlex Group is committed to fostering a diverse and inclusive workplace.

We are an equal opportunity employer, and all qualified candidates will receive consideration for employment regardless of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, or disability.
We are seeking an experienced Class C Licensed Groundwater Plant Operator.
The ideal candidate will be responsible for operating and maintaining equipment used in the treatment of groundwater to ensure compliance with regulatory standards.
*Duties*
Utilize logic controllers to monitor and control groundwater treatment processes
Operate heavy equipment for water treatment purposes
Build, maintain, and repair water treatment systems
Apply mechanical knowledge to troubleshoot and resolve equipment issues
Use basic math skills to analyze data related to groundwater treatment processes
Collect data on water quality and treatment efficiency
Work with distributed control systems to manage groundwater treatment operations
*Skills*
Proficiency in groundwater treatment processes
Experience with logic controllers for monitoring and controlling systems
Ability to operate heavy equipment effectively
Strong mechanical knowledge for maintenance and repair tasks
Basic math skills for data analysis
Capability to analyze and maintain groundwater treatment systems
Familiarity with data collection methods in groundwater treatment operations
Job Types: Full-time, Temporary
Pay: $73.00 per hour
Expected hours: 40 per week
Schedule:
8 hour shift
Day shift
Monday to Friday
Weekends as needed
Required Experience:
Plant Operator: 5 years (Required)
Wastewater treatment: 2 years (Preferred)
Groundwater: 5 years (Required)
Groundwater monitoring: 5 years (Required)
Groundwater remediation: 5 years (Required)
Class C License (Required)
Class C License with Class B: Preferred
Ability to Commute:
Houston, TX (Required)
Ability to Relocate:
Houston, TX: Relocate before starting work (Required)
Work Location:
In person
Company Description
D2 Integrity, LLC was founded in 2022 to create value for our clients by providing efficient and world class engineering, software, and consulting services.
We specialize in pipeline integrity management, ILI technology, regulatory compliance, and software enabled engineering services.
We strive to provide our clients an enjoyable professional environment.
Our differentiator is our staff and collaborative culture.
We are headquartered in Houston, TX.
Role Description
D2 Integrity, LLC is looking to grow our team with an In-line inspection (ILI) Specialist.
This is a full-time position that is primarily remote work with scheduled in person meetings.
The ILI Specialist will be responsible for working Integrity Engineers to perform analysis and assessments using ILI data.
Principal tasks include performing calculations, data analysis, generating reports, and supporting client directly.
Responsibilities
Interpret ILI reports and signal data for various ILI technologies.
Perform calculations and data integration using ILI data for integrity assessments related various integrity threats including but not limited to:
Dent Strain and ECA using geometry ILI data
Bending strain and strain change assessments using IMU ILI data
Box matching and CGR analysis using MFL and UT ILI data.
Various other ILI related tasks associated with signal analysis.
Support Integrity Engineer implement various evaluations using API 1163, API 1176, and API 1183.
Produce reports to document results of analysis.
Maintain an understanding of various ILI technologies work and their application in integrity assessments.
Demonstrate working knowledge of regulatory requirements related to ILI.
Display strong organizational and communication skills related to status of projects, analysis performed, and results of assessments.
Delivery work and reports on-time.
Develop and maintain competency in various service offerings.
Identify learning opportunities for self-improvement.
Identify process improvement opportunities.
Adhere to the company handbook.
Qualifications
Current level 2/3 ILI Data Analyst certification is preferred (MFL, GEO, IMU, UT, EMAT).
BS in Science, Technology, Engineering, or Mathematics is preferred, or equivalent experience.
Minimum of 5 years of related experience in inspection analysis or pipeline integrity management.
Experience with ILI data analysis and interpretation, including MFL, UT, and other NDE technologies.
Strong data analysis and communication skills.
Knowledge of GIS software and spatial data analysis is a plus.
Considerations:
Sponsorship not available.
Canadian and Mexican applicants eligible as contractors.
Compensation & Benefits
Full-Time Position
Work Remote
Competitive Salary
Quarterly Bonus
Annual Bonus
Medical, Dental and Vision Insurance (US only)
401K (US only)
The Director of Institutional Research & Decision Support plays a crucial role at our college, leading efforts to strategically utilize data for informed decision-making.
This senior position involves guiding the quality and interpretation of data, and synthesizing it to enhance processes and inform planning.
In collaboration with senior leadership, the Director ensures that equitable student outcomes remain a primary focus through comprehensive research and planning.
Empathetic Communication: able to communicate complex technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders with grace fostering a collaborative and inclusive team environment.
Enjoys puzzles and solving problems: solving problems and extracting actionable insights from data to provide answers or solutions.
Strategic Thinker: able to think strategically about how data can be leveraged to drive innovation, gain competitive advantage, and create value for the college.
REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS:
• Three (3) years of administrative experience with data science, institutional research, compliance reporting
• Three (3) years of supervisory experience.
• Experience with visualization tools such as Power BI and R/Python.
• Two (2) years of supervisory experience
• Familiarity with research on college student persistence and success.
• Project management certification (PMP).
Chalice Custom Algorithms (chalice.ai) is the leading AI application for brands applying their own data and analytics in the real-time decisioning of ad buys.

Chalice’s software automates data ingestion, predictive analytics, and deployment of custom bidding instructions in a supervised-learning environment, where advertisers can visualize and test their custom algorithms.
Advertisers’ algorithms can be deployed in all major DSPs, as well as Meta and YouTube.
Chalice was named “Best Demand Side Tech” by AdExchanger, and powered AdWeek’s “Best Use of Programmatic” in the 2023 Media Plan of the Year awards.
Key Responsibilities:
As a Lead Associate Director at Chalice, you will:
Act as a Leader: lead customer success initiatives with impact across the company.
Establish scalable processes to build a high-performing customer success team.
Consult on Product Development: Collaborate across Solutions Architecture, Data Science and Engineering to develop products and features that best support customer adoption and growth.
Lead Technical Problem Solving: Collaborate with engineers, data scientists, and product managers to address complex technical issues.
Consult with customers on troubleshooting APIs.
Qualifications:
7+ Years Experience: Demonstrated experience in within ad tech, either in customer success, ad ops, client services or trading.
Experience with data science centric and applied AI technologies is a plus.
Technical Proficiency: Familiarity with programmatic and ideally, social, advertising platforms and AI technologies is a plus, allowing for efficient troubleshooting and guidance.
Joining Chalice means being at the forefront of AI for advertising, working in a stimulating and dynamic environment that encourages creativity, growth, and innovation.
We value diversity, collaboration, and dedication to making a meaningful impact in the advertising landscape.
Chalice is a profitable early-stage company with funding from industry insiders including Trade Desk’s TD7 Ventures and Aperiam Ventures.
Chalice’s philosophy:
AI is too important for brands to outsource
AI should be transparent and auditable
We strive for excellence while fostering learning and creating a supportive work environment.
We are a team of non-conformist, independent thinkers
We are committed to and driven by diversity of thought, background, and experience, and creating the psychological safety for all to thrive
To learn more about Chalice, visit our website.
www.chalice.ai
Location:
Chalice is based in NYC, with a hybrid office/remote work site.
This role is based in NY, with the expectation of 1-2 days a week in office.
Compensation:
This role offers a competitive base salary with a range of $120,000 – $150,0000, depending on experience.
Compensation includes equity in a fast growing early stage company.
Benefits include:
Medical
Dental/vision
401k options
Unlimited PTO
11 Company Holidays
Office wide closure between Christmas Eve and New Years
If you're ready to be part of a team that's shaping the future of advertising through custom AI solutions, reach out, and let's create something amazing together!
Chalice participates in E-Verify.

Chalice will provide the Social Security Administration (SSA) and, if necessary, the Department of Homeland Security (DHS), with information from each new employee’s Form I-9 to confirm work authorization.
For more information, visit https://www.uscis.gov/e-verify.
Codédex is looking for a Senior Curriculum Developer (Contractor) to spearhead the curriculum production.
This is a full-time contract position for 3 months with an opportunity to transition into a full-time salary + equity position and join the founding team.
You can expect ~40 hours of work per week with daily standup meetings, bi-weekly curriculum meetings, and twice a month 1:1s.
👾 What is Codédex?
Codédex is a brand new learn to code platform for Gen Z.
Our mission is to empower the next generation of technologists with the absolute best learning experience!
The pillars that make up Codédex: gamification, world-class content, and community.
https://www.codedex.io
We are based in Brooklyn, NY.
We work from our office in Dumbo two days a week (Tue & Thu) and WFH the other three (MonWedFri).
We are remote-friendly (CST or EST), but prefer a NYC-based candidate.
👤 Responsibilities
Architect byte-sized interactive coding exercises
Review project tutorials written by the community
Apply pedagogy best practices and break down dry technical concepts into fun, digestible components
Collaborate closely with the Engineering team to innovate and push the boundaries of learning to code online
Co-lead the Curriculum bi-weekly meetings and move the ball forward
Address bug reports and curriculum feedback from the community
Lead workshops and office hours 1-2 times a quarter
Report to Founder & CEO
🧳 Qualifications
3+ years of working experience in curriculum writing, technical writing, or similar, preferably in EdTech
Strong foundation in web dev, data science, and/or AI (HTML/CSS, JS, React, Command Line, Python, etc.)
Proficiency in Markdown and GitHub
A strong command of written and spoken English
Experience writing educational content that reaches a broad audience of different age groups
Experience in communicating with remote/hybrid teams
Scrappy, resourceful, and enjoy working in a fast-paced (sometimes chaotic!) startup environment
Self-motivated and a BIG team player
🔥 Bonus Points
Professional experience teaching in the classroom and/or online
Deep knowledge of the popular EdTech platforms
Sweat the details and has an eye for design
Want to grow with the company for years to come
Get in on the ground floor early and receive a once-in-a-lifetime experience building a startup
Work and grow alongside stellar, ultra-passionate teammates in NYC office (lunches provided)
Attend quarterly offsites in NYC (or elsewhere)
Opportunity to transition into a full-time member of the founding team after 3 months
The hourly pay range for this position is $35-$45, depending on experience
⌚️ Hiring Process
20 min: Screening call with the hiring manager.
Submit past work/portfolio examples or submit a short and compensated take-home assignment.
30 min: Team call with 2 team members.
30 min: Final interview with hiring manager (prefer onsite).
The team huddles internally and follows up on the decision!
If this seems like a fit for you, apply and connect with us!
Office Tour: https://www.instagram.com/p/C_0s3YBOP8s
Team: https://www.codedex.io/about

Requirements
Education and Experience:
Required:
Bachelor’s degree in computer science, Data Science, Information Systems, or a related field.
Previous experience of 3-5 years working with ERP platforms such as JD Edwards / SAP ECC / SAP HANA, MS Great Plains / Dynamics to retrieve and consolidate data in the Data Warehouse.
Experience with cloud solutions based on Azure Fabric / Synapse, SQL DB, Snowflake or AWS Redshift.
